attributes.action: Government to hold a referendum by 22 June 2018 on joining the European Union
attributes.background: People who previously advocated leaving the EU had their voice heard in a call for a referendum. In fairness, -but also in terms of observing democratic principles-, the people who (now) advocate to join the EU should also have their voice heard in their call for a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: We, the undersigned, ask this Government (or its successive Government) to hold a referendum by 22 June 2018, on joining the European Union, asking the people of the United Kingdom to choose between the following two options: ‘Join the EU’ or ‘Remain out of the EU’.

attributes.action: Stop parties from supplying 'helpful' questions to ask the PM.
attributes.background: The party in power circulates 'helpful' questions to ask the PM during PM's questions. The number of questions allowed to be asked is limited, therefore these 'helpful' questions are being asked instead of Mp's asking important constituency and national matters.
attributes.additional_details:
Inside the Commons 2015 Season 1 Episode 1 shows this point perfectly and the times stated below explains exactly what we need to stop to allow more important issues being brought up during PMQ's.

Yet another reason why the public feel so wary of politicians, they are constantly wasting time and squandering the chance to reply to real topics, purely for self-gratification.

40:33 - 43:55

attributes.action: Make free healthcare at the point of service a human right
attributes.background: One of the pieces of legislation of the current government is introducing a British bill of rights. The purpose of this petition is for one of those rights to be the right to free healthcare at the point of use.
attributes.additional_details: The purpose of this is to protect the NHS and prevent the privatization of our health service.

attributes.action: We in uk deserves a tax threshold raise from 11k to 68k whatever the income.
attributes.background: We don't mind paying tax. Just don't tax us before the 68k income limit PA. Sign this people it will help everyone.

attributes.action: Increase the Council Tax band values for England to acceptable & relevant levels
attributes.background:
Council Tax valuations are based on the value of properties.

The value is the price the property would have sold for on the open market on 1 April 1991 in England and 1 April 2003 in Wales. Properties were put into a band based on their value on those dates.
attributes.additional_details:
Current Council Tax bands in England (1 April 1991 values)
Band / Value
A	up to £40,000 
B	£40,001 to £52,000
C	£52,001 to £68,000
D	£68,001 to £88,000
E	£88,001 to £120,000
F	£120,001 to £160,000
G	£160,001 to £320,000
H	more than £320,000

https://www.gov.uk

The bands were set in 1991 when house prices were 1/4 of today's value.  Anyone moving house today unfairly falls in to band F,G or H and pays between £2400-£3600 in Tax. The Values/Band should now be quadrupled in line with house prices.

attributes.action: Make it an act of treason to attempt to overturn legitimate elections/referendum
attributes.background: To attempt to overturn a legitimate election/referendum should be considered an act of treason as the action subverts the nation's democratic nature.
attributes.additional_details: It is an act of treason to aid the enemy: to attempt to overturn a legitimate election/referendum should be considered an act of treason as the action runs counter to the nation's democratic nature.

attributes.action: Reunite Britain with a reformed political system
attributes.background: It is clear that the country is divided. England, Scotland, Wales, N. Ireland and London are seemingly at odds with one another and the Westminster elite are not helping. Let's reform the political system to give a fairer, equal governance and voice to the people of the 'United' Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
How? 
1) Devolve more power and money away from Westminster and into the regions.
2) Introduce proportional representation so the electorate have a wider selection of candidates to choose from. Let's eradicate 'wasted' votes.
3) Controversially, introduce compulsory voting. This would force our education sector to be more politically aware and engaging with younger voters.
4) Make electronic voting available to further encourage accessibility.

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit for vans below 7.5ton to the same as cars on a A road
attributes.background:
I've been a van driver for as long as I can remember.
And it just seems mad that a van has to do 50mph on a A road .
When vans this day and age are more safer  than most car's.
Cause more accidents as cars can do 60mph and get impatient and do dangerous overtaking.

attributes.action: In an Indy ref 2, Scottish Regions that vote to remain in the uk should remain.
attributes.background: The SNP government have consistently said that it supports the will of the Scottish people - if that's so then they must support a region by region vote allowing those regions who wish to remain in the uk to do so.
attributes.additional_details: After the eu referendum regional parties jumped on the bandwagon by turning a uk vote in to a countries vote all to further their own agendas. That's fine however if regions within those countries want to remain in the uk they should not be denied their democratic right to do so.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to show a Nazi-style swastika tattoo.
attributes.background: Sporting a Nazi swastika tattoo is as much a hate crime as speaking such sentiments. They should be made illegal if they are visible and tattoo parlours should be punished under the law by fines and prison sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
Swastikas are illegal in Germany and should be illegal in the UK too.
Let us not forget the hundreds of thousands of people who lost their lives fighting Nazism in the last world war and people who think they are somehow being patriotic by having these symbols of hatred engraved in their skin are actually just spitting on their graves.

attributes.action: Hold a post referendum opinion poll on key factors before the exit negotiations.
attributes.background: Public opinion and information have been misrepresented in a highly complex question. Public opinion of key facts (Immigration, Economy, Politics, etc.) should be found before any exit negotiations can take place, to ensure accurate and fair representation of the true feelings of the population.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence of misinterpretation of facts has been shown by those leading the campaigns. Public information and opinion has also been shown to be misinformed, given social media trends (i.e #Regretzit) and search engine results (i.e. What is the EU? / What are the results of leaving the EU?) taking place post the referendum result.

A full and open opinion poll should be carried out to find a better understanding of UK opinion on a wider number of topics involved in the exit debate.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from using both lanes on the 2 lane carriageway A1m,To stop congestion
attributes.background: There is chronic delays on the 2 carriageway A1m by HGV's overtaking HGV's forcing all traffic to 40-50 mph which leads to stood traffic at five lane ends & ferrybridge

attributes.action: Allow students aged 16+ whose parents receive financial aid to gain employment.
attributes.background: Students who's parents receive financial aid from the governments benefits system should be allowed to gain employment as they currently are not. If a parent or career receives benefits then the house hold income must stay the same to what is provided by the government.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing students to gain employment it allows them to learn financial sustainability and also gives them vital work experience which is widely needed to gain future employment. I am a 17 year old student who has to volunteer to use up spare time as I cant gain employment. I would like to earn my own money but cant due to legal reasons. Even if I could only earn a certain amount would be better than none. So please help me with this petition and sign and share to gain work rights for students

attributes.action: Consider independent representatives in all future referendum campaigns.
attributes.background: For all future referendum campaigns, we would like to see the appointment of independent and impartial representatives debate both sides of the argument (with the budget split evenly).  We feel that by doing this, each sides argument is based on fact and not for political gain.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition has been set up in the wake of the European referendum whereby both sides of the debate contained large degrees of scaremongering and, retrospectively it would appear a number of false statements.

We feel that the clear choice in a democratic society is for independent (non-political) representatives to debate both sides in future (based on facts) and with no bias.

attributes.action: Parliament should defer their recess until Article 50 is instigated.
attributes.background: In the light of the major decisions facing this country and pressures from EU Members, require that Parliament defer their recess until the negotiations with the EU over the referendum result, MPs vote on accepting referendum and instigation of Article 50

attributes.action: Raise maximum sentencing on those committing vile racism offences on citizens.
attributes.background: After recent events in the UK, a wave of hatred and racism has overshadowed the democracy to leave the EU. 100's of crimes of online and physical racism have been carried out particularly on EU citizens. With a new future for the country ahead, we need to stamp out this evil with increased severity.
attributes.additional_details: I can speak for the majority of people from both sides of the recent EU referendum who will condemn these vile attacks. Our country should be applauded and renowned for its diversity. Any form of racism against any citizen of any country residing in the UK should be deplored, and an increase in judicial sentencing on such crimes should be approved. Regardless of what world we live in, the UK should welcome all that arrive in this great democracy.

attributes.action: Government should give 350 UK charities 1 million each,

attributes.additional_details: Have worked in Charity Shops Regularly also Donate When Able To.

attributes.action: Start talks on exiting the EU NOW

The people have spoken and voted to leave the EU, David Cameron decided to quit, leaving nobody in charge. Labour MPs quitting, other MPs bickering and not listening to the people.
It's simple: we need to start the process to leave the EU NOW, not several months/years after this pointless nagging

attributes.background: After the destructive Brexit our economy and currency have fallen and the promises made for our healthcare have been broken and now we need to spend £250 million pounds right!
attributes.additional_details: We hope this raises national attention as we want a better Britain and through this money being spend properly we can start straight away.

attributes.action: Reduce current state pensions to pay for any Brexit short fall in Gov' Finances
attributes.background: The majority of over 60's voted for Brexit, the financial impacts of which are to be born by younger generations (loss of access to single market, tightening job markets etc). If there is any financial short fall in Gov' finances due to Brexit it should be paid for by the baby boomers

attributes.action: Future referendums to be subject to a 40% of eligible voters threshold.
attributes.background: A petition to require that all future referendums which would trigger constitutional change should be subject to both an absolute majority of those voting AND a 40% of eligible voters threshold.

attributes.action: A 30 hour working week, also make any extra hours worked payable in overtime.
attributes.background: I work in hospitality, and have realised that the people working in hotels are overworked and very underpaid. But not only in this industry, lorry drivers, security guards shopworkers, every industry.

attributes.action: Only leave EU after an agreement in principle ensuring zero tariff barriers.
attributes.background:
There is  need to ensure the UK has access to the European single market without suffering tariffs.

I believe tariffs will lead to job losses in automotive, aerospace and other manufacturing industries.

attributes.action: If circumstances call for a second EU referendum, voting should be compulsory.
attributes.background:
If another referendum happens but with a similar, or worse, lower turnout - what validates the second result anymore than the first result? 
Australia uses compulsory voting every general election as it delivers a strong mandate for government. 100% turnout would ensure public respect for results.
attributes.additional_details:
As there is already an £80 fine in place for failing to register on the electoral roll, an £80 for failing to turn up to vote is not much of a further stretch. 

Voters remain free to spoil ballots, or not mark a preference, as a form of protest voting - they simply have to turn up. 

We have a few months before David Cameron resigns and athe least a year or so before we REALLY leave the EU. So many have expressed regret for voting out.. the future is still salvageable, but we have to act fast.

attributes.action: Increase funding to engage those 18-24 in the voting process
attributes.background: Turnout has fallen from over 60% in the early 1990s to an average of 40% and is estimated around 36% for Brexit. More funding is needed for neutral education on the system and process.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the British Election Study, the proportion of registered 18 to 24-year-olds turning out to vote has consistently been below every other age group since the 1970s.

Eurobarometer suggested that young British adults are among the least engaged with the political process when comparing their peers across Europe.

Young people do not only vote less, but research by the Electoral Commission suggests they are less likely to be on the electoral register than other age groups.

attributes.action: Add political history and international relations to the school curriculum.
attributes.background: A small number of people knew about how a democracy works at the end of the EU referendum. Even fewer understood what benefits the eu gave and the cost of having it. By adding how Britain creates and maintains relationships and political ideologies to the curriculum we should increase that number.
attributes.additional_details: I think evidence for the need for politics to be added is the large number of people asking for a second referendum because it didn't go their way. These people clearly do not know how a democracy works and they should. There also needs to be teaching into the benefits of international relations and the benefits each nation gives to the UK as well as how those relationships are formed and maintained.I propose they are added into PSHE lessons before the end of formal secondary education at 16.

attributes.action: Move government offices and jobs out of London and spread them across the UK
attributes.background: The vote to leave the EU has clearly shown that London does not connect politically and emotionally as it should with the rest of the U.K. Government offices and jobs should be distributed across Britain to bring the decision makers of this country closer to those they work on behalf of.

attributes.action: Introduce points based system for citizens of non-neighbouring countries.
attributes.background: Introduce points based system for all prospective immigrants who are not citizens of our immediate neighbouring countries (Ireland, France, Iceland, Belgium, Netherlands, Spain, Denmark, Norway, Germany and Sweden. (List of countries to be debated.))

attributes.action: Independence For The South West Of England Creating The Kingdom Of Wessex.
attributes.background: I am sick of politicians In London letting the South West Rot, Not providing enough money for better education, updating infrastructure and stimulating enough jobs or housing for the people like me who was born in the South West and will die in the South West. Now it is time for Independence.
attributes.additional_details: 1) We need updated High speed rail Infrastructure but the government won't spend a penny because we are not worth it despite Devon alone creating over £1Billion in Tourist revenue each year. We need fast and effective rail networks to keep this growing, not clapped out rickety junk. 2) Have a look around the South West town or city you live in and you can tell there is a massive lack of funding for everything. Not enough police on the streets, or enough to even investigate crime any crime.

attributes.action: Allow students (12-16 age) to vote in the (second) EU Referendum

attributes.additional_details:
The pound rate has already gone down meaning UK will be badly financially affected.UK won't be able to trade in EU countries.Pupil from other European countries won't be able to migrate in UK and make our country proud.Example:Mo Farah,who is a migrant who made Britain PROUD.
Remember a quote from a girl "It's better to be part of something that is bigger than yourself" Would you like to be alone for your whole life or be with someone who will support you?
"Be safe and remain in EU"

attributes.action: Make it law that only one referendum can be held on an issue in a 5 year period
attributes.background: Following the result of the EU referendum which took months of campaigning and cost millions of taxpayer's pounds, some people who voted remain are attempting to have a 2nd referendum called because they weren't happy with the majority vote. A referendum should be a one time vote on an issue.
attributes.additional_details: A 2nd EU referendum would cost millions of pounds more of tax payers money and be inflicted on a public who generally don't have the appetite for a 2nd referendum. This would be the case in future referendums on other issues too as a precedent would be set now if a 2nd referendum was called.

attributes.action: Stop all future referendums from July 2016
attributes.background: Referendums cause division, animosity and pull the country apart.

attributes.action: Have the EU referendum for 28.8% that didn't vote, teens & British residents.
attributes.background: Only a quarter (26.74%) of Britain voted to LEAVE the EU. 28.8% registered voters, millions who couldn't register, 16-17 year old Brits, and UK residents, have had no say. Democracy is not a privilege of the few, and the EU referendum is incomplete and invalid currently & it must be completed.

attributes.action: In a 2nd EU referendum, only those whom did not vote initially may take part.
attributes.background: It is the only way which is fair.

attributes.action: to create a house of lords with 100 ELECTED members
attributes.background: austerity should of started with the amount we waste on the nearly 900 peers in the house of lords. america has 535 politicians in both houses it is time to reduce our politicians.

attributes.action: Hold a 2nd Referendum on the EU requiring all registered voters to cast a vote.
attributes.background: In the first vote only 37.44% of registered voters decided the long term future of the UK. This is not true Democracy.

attributes.action: Make voting compulsory for everyone over 16yrs and make sure its enforced.
attributes.background: I believe we should have a full and transparent view of our voting system, the voting for the EU referendum as a example why we should have a full view of every vote. 100% turn out and show a true scale of the votes so we dont have an issue with nearly half the country crying foul over non-voters
attributes.additional_details: EU Referendum - Massive outcry over voter turnout.

attributes.action: Negotiate with EU to allow UK/EU passports to give full EU passage until expired
attributes.background: UK passport holders need the right of passage within existing EU territories using our UK/EU passport in the same way as we use Pre Referendum

attributes.action: Block retrospective changes to the European Referendum Act 2015
attributes.background: The referendum to leave the European Union was carried out fairly and in line with the following act; European Union Referendum Act 2015. We the undersigned petition that this act is not ammended retrospectively and no provisions made for a minimum turnout to be achieved for results to be binding.

attributes.action: UK referendums to last a minimum of ten years, before repeating.
attributes.background: Scottish independence and EU referendum results to remain law for a minimum of ten years, along with any others which may follow.

attributes.action: Unite the country! An enquiry into the existing divide in the voting class
attributes.background: The UK on the 23rd June 2016 voted to leave the EU. The country had prior to, been subjected to scaremongering, distortion of facts and in general a politics filled with hate, divide and manipulation.
attributes.additional_details: In the aftermath of the vote, we awoke to a country on the verge on a breakup, with calls for a 2nd EU Referendum, a petition for the declaration of London's  independence and of course the call for a 2nd Scottish Referendum. We believe there is an urgent need for the UK Parliament to act and to prioritise the need to unite the country.We urge Parliament to examine the cause of the stark divide in society as reflected by the results of the EU Referendum by setting up a panel of enquiry.

attributes.action: Give Bristol, Cambridge and other remain areas the chance to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
Scotland and London have significantly voted to remain. As such actions are being taken to protect their democratic decision. 

Other parts of the UK have also strongly voted to remain and in any devolution options should have the option to join the parts of the UK that choose to remain in the EU
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland are securing their right to have a 2nd referendum and London has a petition going strongly.

Certain areas and cities have overwhelmingly voted to remain in the EU, including Gibraltar, Northern Ireland, Manchester, Oxford, Brighton and more. These areas should not have their British identity stripped in devolution without choosing what their new identity will be.

attributes.action: Hold a Second EU Referendum for all 11 to 18 Year olds and combine the totals
attributes.background: The EU Referendum Vote held on Thursday 23rd of June 2016, was not democratic and failed to provide all people the vital information required to make an informed decision and most importantly failed to involve the most important people whose very futures depend on the vote

attributes.action: Make UK election/referendum process compulsory in the national curriculum.
attributes.background: It is evident from many media reports after the recent EU referendum and following local/general elections, that a significant percentage of UK residents do not fully understand election/referendum processes. It reasonably follows that UK-wide education is required to remedy this.
attributes.additional_details: Too many references to mention in media of all natures including popularly watched/listened to television/radio channels and social media networks.

attributes.action: Make discrimination against homeless people a lawfully recognised hate crime
attributes.background: A hate crime is defined in British law as an act of violence or hostility directed at someone because of who they are yet homeless people are not covered by this law. We want new legislation to further prosecute people who commit hate crimes against homeless people.
attributes.additional_details: One year 52% of homeless people suffered from violence (Source: Crisis). Whilst this in itself is a criminal offence it is not further punishable under the Criminal Justice Act 2003. We would also like to have police support and advice to be more widely available for homeless people. Many homeless people are afraid to report incidents to police and we would like change this.

attributes.action: Mandate gov't to create a non partisan advisory panel for the Brexit process
attributes.background: Mandate the government to create an independent advisory body of experts (across finance, business, politics, academia etc) to support and advise on the Brexit process - to ensure the best result for the British people. Advisory Council to represent all professional spheres.
attributes.additional_details:
On June 23rd 2016, the UK voting populace voted at the EU referendum to leave the European Union - with a simple majority of approx 52%. Following this, the Prime Minister has indicated he will step aside for a Brexit government to lead the country to invoke the leaving process.
A new government will require the support and expertise of a non-political advisory body, to bring the best research and knowledge in achieving the most beneficial Brexit for the British, EU and global populations.

attributes.action: The public to decide what 10 issues they want addressing and in which priority.
attributes.background:
So in a nutshell, a system which allows the people’s top 10 issues to be listed, prioritised and given measurable performance criteria with dated milestones for interim measurement.

These issues would be updated at each new election or after coming out of the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
All parties would have same top 10 KIP's which would give consistency and allow performance to be easily measured and compared by the average person.

Currently, all the different party manifestoes are complied by themselves and can’t be easily cross-referenced. This means performance measurement is not easy for the average person.

Obviously the parties they would have all the other issues which can be prioritised and outlined in their own way.
